records.subject: Always use HTML mode on replies

records.headers:
To: {{{default.replyto_email}}}
From: Alessio Costa <a.costa@fiaflux.example>
Subject: Always use HTML mode on replies
X-Mailer: Gmail
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Message-Id: <convo1.msg1@cerb.example>
records.content:
I'd like to require our workers to always use HTML mode for replies in Cerb. Right now we have to select 'Switch to Markdown' on every reply. Is there an option to make this the default for everyone?

-- 
Alessio Costa, Developer
Fiaflux Software

records.headers:
To: Alessio Costa <a.costa@fiaflux.example>
From: {{{default.replyto_email}}}
Subject: Re: Always use HTML mode on replies
X-Mailer: Cerb
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Message-Id: <convo1.msg2@cerb.example>
records.content:
> I'd like to require our workers to always use HTML mode for replies in
> Cerb. Right now we have to select 'Switch to Markdown' on every reply. Is
> there an option to make this the default for everyone?

Hi Alessio,

Each worker can configure that preference with these instructions:

1. Click your name in the top right
2. Select 'settings'
3. Under 'While replying:' check the box for 'Always switch to HTML mode'
4. Save changes

We don't have a global preference for this yet where admins can set the default for everyone. I'll check with the developers to see if that's something we can do in the next update.

-- 
Kina Halpue, Support

records.comment: @Milo How difficult would it be to create a global preference for HTML mode on replies? Fiaflux wants workers to reply in HTML by default without each worker having to configure the preference.

records.headers:
To: {{{default.replyto_email}}}
From: Alessio Costa <a.costa@fiaflux.example>
Subject: Re: Always use HTML mode on replies
X-Mailer: Gmail
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Message-Id: <convo1.msg3@cerb.example>
In-Reply-To: <convo1.msg2@cerb.example>
records.content:
Kina wrote:
> Each worker can configure that preference with these instructions:

Thanks... That will be better than switching to HTML on every reply.

> We don't have a global preference for this yet where admins can set 
> the default for everyone. I'll check with the developers to see 
> if that's something we can do in the next update.

That would be ideal. We have 22 workers and it will be tedious to have everyone change their own settings.

-- 
Alessio Costa, Developer
Fiaflux Software

records.comment: @Kina We could add global mail preferences to Setup->Mail->Settings without much difficulty. I went ahead and filed it as feature request #1234 on GitHub.

records.headers:
To: Alessio Costa <a.costa@fiaflux.example>
From: {{{default.replyto_email}}}
Subject: Re: Always use HTML mode on replies
X-Mailer: Cerb
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Message-Id: <convo1.msg4@cerb.example>
records.content:
> That would be ideal. We have 22 workers and it will be tedious to have
> everyone change their own settings.

Hi Alessio,

We filed your feature request here:
https://github.com/jstanden/cerb/issues

You'll receive a notification by email with any progress.

-- 
Kina Halpue, Support

records.headers:
To: {{{default.replyto_email}}}
From: Sergey Polzin <s.polzin@nechist.example>
Subject: Server requirements for Cerb
X-Mailer: Yahoo Mail
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Message-Id: <convo2.msg1@cerb.example>
records.content:
Hello,

I have seen the server software requirements:
https://cerb.ai/docs/installation/#server-requirements

However, I would like to know about the hardware requirements for Cerb. Should this be a dedicated machine? 
Should the database and web server be separate?

-- 
Sergey Polzin, CTO
Nechist Financial

records.headers:
From: {{{default.replyto_email}}}
To: Sergey Polzin <s.polzin@nechist.example>
Subject: Re: Server requirements for Cerb
X-Mailer: Cerb
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Message-Id: <convo2.msg2@cerb.example>
records.content:
> However, I would like to know about the hardware requirements for Cerb.
> Should this be a dedicated machine?
> Should the database and web server be separate?

Hi Sergey,

There isn't a "one size fits all" recommendation for server specs. It really depends on how many simultaneous workers will be using your system; but in most cases the server can be a virtual machine and/or also serving other sites and apps.

As you scale, the main bottleneck will usually be write traffic to the database. The main consideration there is just giving enough RAM to MySQL so it can cache the indexes in memory. You can use a tool like mysqltuner to monitor that.

I'd also recommend using SSD drives for the database I/O if at all possible.

How many simultaneous workers do you expect to use the system at peak times?

-- 
Milo Dade, Developer

records.headers:
To: {{{default.replyto_email}}}
From: Zöe De Vos <z.de.vos@donter.example>
Subject: No mail received after installation...
X-Mailer: Gmail
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Message-Id: <convo3.msg1@cerb.example>
records.content:
I installed Cerb an hour ago and haven't received new email in the system.

I sent a test message, so something should definitely be there.

Please advise on what I may have missed.

Zöe De Vos - Technology Advisor
Donter Institute

X-Mailer: Hotmail
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Message-Id: <convo6.msg1@cerb.example>
records.content:
You be needing to think faster than competition? Make lots of money piles and sail this world with your honey mate?

The answer is here in finally time with no waiting!

500 pills bottle. Eat an pill, be thinking like a computer robot. Consume two, no having to terminate early job day for snoozing time. No brain decision.

Send 0.01 BTC at wallet aLLy0uRm0N3Y4R3b3L0nG2US. You are to soon be best you - based on actually science paper.

records.title: Sales: Calculate license cost
Welcome to Cerb!
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
This project board provides a quick checklist for getting Cerb up and running.

Drag cards from the top of the TODO backlog into the In Progress column to work on them. You should limit the in progress cards to only a few at a time.

When you finish a card, drag it from In Progress to Completed!. You'll notice that a bot automatically marks the task completed for you.

This on-boarding workflow was built entirely with Cerb's tools in the browser. You can , , and to see how it works (or even make changes).

Drag this card to Completed!

records.title: Configure branding
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
1. Navigate to Setup » Configure » Branding.
  2. Upload your logo.

records.title: Configure sender addresses
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
2. Click the icon to add new email addresses.
  3. Add a to an address to enable it as a outgoing sender.

records.title: Configure email signatures
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
2. Click the icon to add new signatures.
  3. Modify signatures to meet your needs.

records.title: Configure mailboxes
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note: 2. Click the icon to add new mailboxes.

records.title: Review groups
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
2. Click the icon to add new groups.
  3. Review the mail settings for each group.

records.title: Invite other team members
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note: 2. Click the icon to create new workers.

records.title: Configure roles
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
2. Determine the permissions for each role.
  3. Assign the roles to workers and groups.

records.title: Create a home workspace
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
1. Click on the icon in the top navigation bar.
  2. Click Help me create a page! at the top.
  3. Click Home.
  4. Click Save Changes.

records.title: Create a mail workspace
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
1. Click on the icon in the top navigation bar.
  2. Click Help me create a page! at the top.
  3. Click Mail.
  4. Click Save Changes.

records.title: Add your license
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
1. Request a free 3-seat license if you haven't already.
  2. Install your license in Setup » Configure » License.

records.title: Enable the scheduler
records.custom_{{{uid.field_getting_started_note:
1. Navigate to Setup » Configure » Scheduler.
  2. Configure the scheduler to run automatically.

records.title: Cerb server requirements
records.content:
**This** is article content
With two lines

params.message: Check out the {{workspace}} workspace we automatically created for you.

params.quick_search: responseTime:>0 isOutgoing:y created:"-1 month 00:00:00 to now"

actions.message: This is a shortcut to a bot interaction right on your dashboard.
